\frac{\partial^n}{\partial z^n} \left[ \int_X f(z, x) \, d\mu(x) \right]
  =
  \int_X \partial_z^n
  f(z, x) \, d\mu(x).

\partial_z f(z, x) 
  = \frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\gamma} \frac{\partial_z f(w, x)}{w-z} \, dw
  = \frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\gamma} \frac{f(w, x)}{(w-z)^2} \, dw,

\frac{\partial}{\partial z} \left[ \int_{\gamma} f(z, w) \, dw \right]
  =
  \int_{\gamma} \partial_z
  f(z, w) \, dw.

\frac{\partial}{\partial z} \left[ \int_{\gamma} f(z, w) \, dw \right]
  =
  \int_{[0,1]} \partial_z f(z, \gamma(t)) \gamma'(t) \, dt.

\int_{\mathbb{R}_+} |f(t) e^{-s t}| \, dt
  = 
  \int_{\mathbb{R}_+} |f(t)| e^{-\mathrm{Re}(s) t} \, dt \leq \int_{\mathbb{R}_+} |f(t)| e^{-\sigma^+ t} \, dt < + \infty.

\int_{\mathbb{R}_+} |f(t) e^{-wt}| \, dt 
  =
  \int_{\mathbb{R}_+} |f(t)| e^{-\mathrm{Re}(w)t} \, dt 
  \leq
  \int_{\mathbb{R}_+} |f(t)| e^{-(\sigma + \epsilon)t} \, dt
  < +\infty.

\frac{\partial}{\partial s}\int_0^{+\infty} f(t) e^{-st} \, dt
  =
  \int_0^{+\infty} -t f(t) e^{-st} \, dt
  =
  \mathcal{L} [t \mapsto -t f(t)](s)

g(z, w) = 
  \frac{f(z) - f(w)}{z - w} \; \mbox{ if }\; z \neq w 
  \; \mbox{ and } \;
  g(w, w) = f'(w).

\begin{split}
  h(z) 
  &= \frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\gamma} \frac{f(z) - f(w)}{z - w}  dw \\
  &= f(z) \mathrm{ind}(\gamma, z)
  - \frac{1}{i2\pi}  \int_{\gamma} \frac{f(w)}{z - w}  dw \\
  &=
  - \frac{1}{i2\pi}  \int_{\gamma} \frac{f(w)}{z - w}  dw
  \end{split}.

\frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\gamma} \frac{f(w)}{z - w}  dw
  =
  \frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\gamma} \frac{f(z)}{z - w}  dw
  =
  \mathrm{ind}(\gamma, z)  f(z),

**Definition -- Cauchy Transform on the Unit Circle.** 
The Cauchy transform of a complex-valued Borel measure $\mu$ defined on 
the unit circle $\mathbb{U}$ is the function
  $$
  z \in \mathbb{C} \setminus \mathbb{U} 
  \mapsto
  \frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\mathbb{U}} \frac{1}{1 - \overline{w} z} d \mu(w).
  $$

**Definition -- Cauchy Transform on the Real Line.** 
The Cauchy transform of a complex-valued Borel measure $\mu$ defined on 
$\mathbb{R}$ is the function
  $$
  z \in \mathbb{C} \setminus \mathbb{R} 
  \mapsto
  \frac{1}{i2\pi} \int_{\mathbb{R}} \frac{1}{t - z} d \mu(t).
  $$
